arts.ttl: Sunderland moves into fourth place after home draw with Everton
arts.sum: The Black Cats were on top for most of the second period but could not get the goal that would have taken it above Manchester City and into second place. Sunderland came back from a goal down to draw with Everton 1-1 and moved into fourth spot in the Premier League on Monday.

arts.ttl: Sunderland 1-1 Everton: Sunderland retain unbeaten home record with a draw against Everton
arts.sum: Everton looked to be in complete control after taking an early lead but Sunderland fought back and looked the more likely winners after the half hour mark. They did, however, manage to level the game up within the opening minute of the second half: Xhaka‚Äôs shot was deflected onto the crossbar via James Tarkowski and into the net, past a helpless Jordan Pickford.

arts.sum: Granit Xhaka scores his first Sunderland goal as the Black Cats come from behind to draw with Everton and move up to fourth place in the Premier League.
